segments.text: Wake up , Erik , time to rise and shine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Huh , oh , hi , Jane . I must have fallen asleep while I was reading .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You and everyone else . It looks more like a camp-ground than a library .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , the dorm ’ s too noisy to study in , and I guess this place is too quiet .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Have you had any luck finding a topic for your paper ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . Prof . Grant told us to write about anything in cultural anthropology . For once I wish she hadn ’ t given us so much of a choice .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , why not write about the ancient civilizations of Mexico . You seem to be interested in that part of the world .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am , but there is too much material to cover . I ’ ll be writing forever , and Grant only wants five to seven pages .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So they limit it to one region of Mexico . Say the Yucatan . You ’ Ve been there and you said it ’ s got lots of interesting relics .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s not a bad idea . I brought many plenty of books and things back with me last summer . That would be great resource material . Now if I can only remember where I put them .
segments.speaker: S2
